intro: Solanum umbelliferum, commonly known as the umbellate nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to South America and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe, containing toxic seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its toxic properties, it is not commonly cultivated for ornamental or agricultural purposes.
